flawed_nl_solution:
Three years from now, Kate will be 29 years + 3 years = <<29+3=32>>32 years old.
So by that time, Tully will be 32 years x 2 = <<32*2=64>>64 years old.
This means, Tully is 64 years - 3 years = <<64-3=61>>61 years old now.
Therefore, Tully was 61 years - 1 year = 57 years old last year.

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 60, not 57. This appears to be a minor miscalculation.
